Every computer needs a CD drive so that you are able to insert and use software as needed. However, most drives come in a CD/DVD format, where they are able to read both CDs and DVDs. If you plan on burning files to disks, opt for a higher write speed as indicated by the ##X. If you desire Blu-ray playback, select a drive that has Blu-ray capability (CDs and DVDs are compatible with them, as well).
If you want to watch/burn Blu-ray disks, select a drive that has Blu-ray compatability.
